title: éƒ­æ˜çªï¼š 2023 å¹´ iPhone å¯èƒ½ä¼šæ¢ Type-C
content: My latest survey indicates that 2H23 new iPhone will abandon Lightning port and switch to USB-C port. USB-C could improve iPhone's transfer and charging speed in hardware designs, but the final spec details still depend on iOS support. It's expected to see existing USB-C-related suppliers of Apple's ecosystem (e.g., IC controller, connector) become the market's focus in the next 1-2 years, thanks to vast orders from iPhones and accessories' adoption of USB-C ports. (@Ming-Chi Kuo)
content_rendered: My latest survey indicates that 2H23 new iPhone will abandon Lightning port and switch to USB-C port. USB-C could improve iPhone's transfer and charging speed in hardware designs, but the final spec details still depend on iOS support. It's expected to see existing USB-C-related suppliers of Apple's ecosystem (e.g., IC controller, connector) become the market's focus in the next 1-2 years, thanks to vast orders from iPhones and accessories' adoption of USB-C ports. (@Ming-Chi Kuo)

title: å…³äº RUST ç”Ÿå‘½å‘¨æœŸçš„ç–‘é—®
content_rendered:
è¿™æ˜¯ä»£ç 

fn main() {
    let n = String::from("rust");
    let myname;
    {
        let obj = AA{
            name: &n
        };
        myname = obj.get_name();
    }
    println!("{}", myname)

}

struct AA<'a>{
    name: &'a str
}

impl <'a> AA<'a>{
    fn get_name(&self) -> & str{
        return &self.name;
    }
}
